children.name: cloud
children.definition: a white or grey mass in the sky that rain falls from: mây, đám mây
examples: There wasn’t a single cloud in the sky.

children.name: a black/grey cloud
examples: Black clouds usually mean rain.

children.name: a dark cloud
children.definition: a black or grey cloud
examples: A dark cloud covered the sun.

children.name: a white cloud
examples: There was a bright blue sky with a few white clouds.

children.name: heavy/thick cloud
children.definition: alsodense cloudformal
examples: By midday, heavy clouds had spread across the sky.

children.name: low/high cloud
examples: The weather was overcast, with heavy low clouds.

children.name: storm clouds
examples: Dark storm clouds were moving in from the Atlantic.

children.name: rain clouds
examples: The sky had been full of rain clouds for days.

children.name: a bank/mass of cloud
children.definition: a large block of cloud
examples: A heavy bank of cloud was creeping across the sky.

children.name: a layer of cloud
examples: The moon was shining through a thin layer of cloud.

children.name: wisps of cloud
children.definition: long thin pieces
examples: The plane flew through occasional wisps of cloud.

children.name: a band of cloud
children.definition: a long narrow area
examples: Long narrow bands of cloud stretched across the valley.

children.name: a blanket of cloud
children.definition: a thick layer
examples: In the morning, a blanket of cloud still covered the country.

children.name: a veil of cloud
children.definition: a thin layer
examples: A thin veil of cloud hid the moon.

children.name: clouds gather/form
examples: The sky had darkened and clouds had gathered.

children.name: clouds cover something
examples: For days thick cloud had covered the whole sky.

children.name: clouds clear/lift
children.definition: disappear
examples: At last the rain had stopped and the clouds had cleared.

children.name: clouds part
children.definition: move away from each other
examples: Suddenly the clouds that covered the moon parted.

children.name: clouds move/roll
examples: A narrow band of cloud has been moving across the country.

children.name: clouds drift/float
children.definition: move slowly
examples: A few clouds drifted across the top of the mountains.

children.name: clouds race/scud
children.definition: move quickly
examples: A wind was blowing and soft clouds were scudding across the sky.

children.name: clouds hang
examples: Heavy grey clouds hung low in the sky.

children.name: cloud cover
examples: The cloud cover should disappear by the afternoon.

children.name: cloud formation
children.definition: the shape in which cloud forms
examples: There are many different types of cloud formation.

children.name: fog
children.definition: thick cloudy air near the ground that is very difficult to see through: sương mù

children.name: thick/dense/heavy fog
children.definition: great in amount and difficult to see through
examples: The two lorries collided in heavy fog.

children.name: freezing fog
examples: Flights were cancelled due to freezing fog.

children.name: swirling fog
children.definition: which blows around
examples: She could not see through the swirling fog.

children.name: patchy fog
children.definition: in some areas but not in others
examples: Mist and patchy fog will form tonight.

children.name: hill/sea/ground fog
examples: Rain was forecast, along with hill fog.

children.name: be covered in fog
examples: The mountains were covered in fog.

children.name: be shrouded in fogliterary
examples: The streets of London were shrouded in fog.

children.name: the fog comes down
children.definition: alsothe fog descendsliterary
examples: (= it appears )Day after day the fog came down.

children.name: the fog rolls in
children.definition: it arrives from the mountains, the sea etc
examples: The fog rolled in from the ocean.

children.name: the fog lifts
children.definition: it disappears
examples: He sat and waited for the fog to lift.

children.name: a blanket of fog
children.definition: a large area of fog
examples: A blanket of fog lay over the town.

children.name: a bank of fog
children.definition: alsoa fog bank
examples: (= a large mass of fog )As we approached the coast, we ran into a dense bank of fog.

children.name: patches of fog
children.definition: fog that forms in some places but not in others
examples: Patches of fog are expected later today.

children.name: the fog
examples: I could just make out a dim figure coming towards me in the fog.

children.name: the fog lifts/clearsit goes away
examples: The fog has almost cleared - our plane will be able to take off soon.

children.name: smog
children.definition: air pollution, especially in cities, that is caused by a mixture of smoke, gases and chemicals: khói bụi
examples: Smog is a major problem in Athens.
As we flew into the airport, we could see a murky yellow smog hovering over the city.

children.name: mist
children.definition: wet light cloud near the ground, which is difficult to see through clearly: sương mù
examples: A light mist lay in the valley.
The mist along the river banks had gone by mid-morning.

children.name: be covered in mist
children.definition: alsobe shrouded in mistliterary
examples: The tops of the mountains were shrouded in mist.

children.name: a mist comes down/in
children.definition: comes to a place
examples: The mist came down like a curtain.

children.name: a mist rolls in
children.definition: moves along to a place
examples: A mist began to roll in off the sea.

children.name: the mist clears/lifts
children.definition: goes away
examples: The mountains suddenly appeared as the mist lifted.

children.name: mist swirls
children.definition: moves in circles
examples: The boat disappeared into the swirling mist.

children.name: a mist hangs/lies somewhere
children.definition: stays in a place
examples: A thick mist lay on the hills.

children.name: a mist drifts
children.definition: moves slightly
examples: A mist drifted over the marsh.

children.name: a mist rises
children.definition: comes up from something such as water
examples: I could see the mist rising from the river.

children.name: a mist obscures/hides something
children.definition: covers something so that you cannot see it
examples: Mist obscured the ships in the harbor.

children.name: disappear/vanish into the mist
children.definition: stop being seen because of the mist
examples: He passed me on the trail and disappeared into the mist.

children.name: appear out of the mist
children.definition: alsoemerge from the mist
examples: Suddenly my commanding officer appeared out of the mist.

children.name: loom out of the mist
children.definition: start being seen in a way that is not clear, because the mist still covers it slightly
examples: Here and there trees loomed out of the mist.

children.name: a fine/light mist
examples: A fine mist began to settle on the water.

children.name: a thick/heavy mist
examples: Outside, a heavy mist obscured everything.

children.name: the morning/evening mist
examples: The sun broke through the morning mist.

children.name: autumn mist
children.definition: s
examples: The field looked magical in the autumn mist.

children.name: a sea mist
examples: Alice sailed into a small patch of sea mist.

children.name: a veil/curtain of mist
children.definition: an amount of mist that prevents you seeing something clearly
examples: We looked up, through the veil of mist, at the waterfall.

children.name: haze
children.definition: smoke, dust, or mist in the air which is difficult to see through: mờ
examples: The sun was surrounded by a golden haze.
The road shimmered in theheat haze.
A pale blue haze hung over the far-off mountains.
haze of
a haze of cigarette smoke
He saw the horses coming towards him through a haze of dust.

children.name: thundercloud
children.definition: a large dark cloud that you see before or during a storm: mây dông
examples: He watched the thunderclouds roll across the valley.

children.name: vapor trail
children.definition: vapour trail  water vapour that looks like a line of white smoke behind an aircraft as it flies: vệt hơi nước sau máy bay
examples: High overhead, a jet left its vapour trail across the blue sky.

children.name: overcast
children.definition: if the sky is overcast, it is very cloudy and dark, and there will probably be rain: u ám
examples: The sky was overcast, and a light rain began to fall.
The weather was overcast.

children.name: cloudy
children.definition: a cloudy sky, day etc is dark because there are a lot of clouds
examples: The weather was cold and cloudy.
cloudy skies
a cloudy night with some light rain
Tomorrow, it will be cloudy and cool.

children.name: dull
children.definition: if the weather is dull, it is cloudy and there is no sunshine: u ám, ảm đạm
examples: It will be dry but dull this morning, with the possibility of showers later in the day.

children.name: grey
children.definition: / gray  cloudy and not at all bright: xám xịt, u ám ; ảm đạm
examples: It was a grey winter morning.
Night turned into morning, grey and cold.

children.name: foggy
children.definition: with thick low cloud that is difficult to see through. You usefoggyespecially about low-lying places: nhiều sương mù
examples: a foggy day in London in November
a foggy November evening

children.name: misty
children.definition: with light low cloud that is difficult to see through. You usemistyespecially about places that are next to water or in the mountains:

children.name: a cold misty morning
examples: It may be misty in the east in the morning.
The morning will start off misty.

children.name: hazy
children.definition: with air that looks cloudy, because there is smoke, dust, or mist in it: lờ mờ
examples: hazy sunshine
the hazy days of summer

children.name: gloomy
children.definition: dark and cloudy, in a depressing way: u ám, ảm đạm
examples: The gloomy weather shows no sign of improving.

children.name: leaden
children.definition: a leaden sky is grey and full of dark clouds: nặng nề
examples: Snow fell from a leaden sky.

children.name: smoggy
children.definition: nhiều khói bụi
examples: MexicoCityis one of the world's smoggiest capitals.

children.name: dew
children.definition: drops of water that form on the ground and other surfaces outside during the night: sương
examples: dewdrop[ C ] a drop of dew :giọt sương; hạt sương
dewy[adj] cósương
a dewy morning
